akn:section.akn:heading: Office of Advocacy within Small Business Administration; Chief Counsel for Advocacy

akn:content.akn:p:
§ 634a. Office of Advocacy within Small Business Administration; Chief Counsel for Advocacy There is established within the Small Business Administration an Office of Advocacy. The management of the Office shall be vested in a Chief Counsel for Advocacy who shall be appointed from civilian life by the President, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate. (Pub. L. 94–305, title II, § 201, June 4, 1976, 90 Stat. 668.)
Editorial Notes Codification Section was not enacted as part of the Small Business Act which comprises this chapter.
